column4: Open SuSE 64 bit was slower than Ubuntu 64 bit, so that's why I switched to Ubuntu after SuSE 10.1 came out after being with SuSE since 9.1
(on SuSE)
My 64 bit Ubuntu is the most stable machine I've used believe it or not.
64 bit Edgy.
Yeah, if you don't want WINE, 64 bit is great actually for me.
Flash works though.
I had my video drivers installed though.
yeah i agree, even if you want wine it can be done - i did it
yeah i had twinview working for me too it rocks :D
- what version of nvidia-glx are using?
ummm
- did you have to install other repositories to make that work or ?
- so you did them manually?
- ok how does that work though when you have an update to the kernel?
I don't remember XD
- no it has 32bit too
try going to #ubuntu-xgl and asking who owns http://nvidia.limitless.lupine.me.uk/
- yeah i'm just reluctant to jump to edgy without knowing how that will turn out - i have a very nice stable dapper but has old 8776 drivers on it
- one last question, you ever update you're kernel yet since installing this beryl guys nvidia stuff?
I run 2.6.17-10-generic
- ok thanks
did you're old dapper x config work in edgy too?
